intro: Pecluma divaricata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Pecluma divaricata is also known for its ability to adapt to various indoor environments.
